Package pieces

Class King

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
      • pieces.King
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class King
extends Piece
    This class extends the abstract class piece and is the class that initializes king objects and has its necessary functions which were inherited from the abstract class.
    Author:
    Chiraag Rekhari and Jahnavi Bavuluri
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean castling
      variable that is toggled true/false depending on if the current king can be castled

      King​(java.lang.String color, int x, int y, boolean castling)

      void castling​(Board b, java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> moves)
      This method adds valid castling moves to the getMoves ArrayList if the king and rook can castle.

    • Field Detail

      • castling

        public boolean castling
        variable that is toggled true/false depending on if the current king can be castled

    • Constructor Detail

      • King

        public King​(java.lang.String color,
            int x,
            int y,
            boolean castling)
        The constructor calls the superclasses constructor which sets the color,x,and y. The name is set to wK or bK depending if the color is black or white.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the king
        x - the x location of the king on the board
        y - the y location of the king on the board
        castling - set to true if the current king can be castled

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Getter method that returns the name of the king
        Specified by:
        getName in class Piece
        Returns:
        the name of the Piece to be drawn in the board

      • setCastling

        public void setCastling​(boolean b)
        Setter method that sets the castling variable to the parameter given.
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean value which castling variable will be set to

      • basicMovement

        public void basicMovement​(Board b,
                          java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves)
        This method populates the getMoves ArrayList with the valid moves for a particular king object on the board b that is passed in.
        Parameters:
        b - current board object that is being played on
        getMoves - ArrayList that stores all the valid moves for a particular king object

      • castling

        public void castling​(Board b,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> moves)
        This method adds valid castling moves to the getMoves ArrayList if the king and rook can castle.
        Parameters:
        b - current board object that is being played on
        moves - ArrayList that stores all the valid moves for a particular king object

      • kingInCheck

        public boolean kingInCheck​(Board b,
                           java.awt.Point point)
        Checks if the opposing pieces puts the current players king in check.

        This varies from the board method as this method does not include the King pieces. It checks solely for check on the other pieces.

        Parameters:
        b - current board object that is being played on
        point - the location that is being checked to see if it is in check
        Returns:
        true if the point is in check, false otherwise

      • getMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getMoves​(Board b,
                                                    boolean check)
        This method calls castling and basicMovement to populate the ArrayList Moves and checks if each move puts its own king in check
        Specified by:
        getMoves in class Piece
        Parameters:
        b - the board that the Piece is on
        check - checks valid Points that does not put own king in check
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Points that the given Piece can move to
